Authors: Hongmin no Zhou, Yu Cheng Dai
Title:
Two new species of Albatrellus sensu lato (Albatrellaceae,
Basidiomycota) from China
Keywords:
Albatrellus sensu lato, russuloid, phylogeny,
taxonomy
Abstract:
Based on morphological and molecular data, two new species
of Albatrellus sensu lato, A. alpinus and Scutiger edulis, are described
from Yunnan Province of southwestern China. Phylogenetic analyses based
on the internal transcribed spacer regions (ITS), the large subunit of
nuclear ribosomal RNA gene (nLSU), the small subunit mitochondrial rRNA
gene (mtSSU) indicated that the two new species were nested within the
genera Albatrellus sensu stricto and Scutiger. Albatrellus alpinus is
characterized by buff to pale yellow pileal surface, clamped generative
hyphae with yellow and shapeless oily substance, and small amyloid
basidiospores. Scutiger edulis is characterized by curry-yellow to
cinnamon-buff pileal surface which becoming buff to olivaceous buff upon
drying, with coarse squamulose, and ellipsoid to teardrop-shaped,
non-amyloid basidiospores. Differences between the two new species and
their similar species were discussed. A key to Chinese species of
Albatrellus sensu lato is provided.
